resources.string:
This is a Dialog activity.

Starting it will only trigger the onPause lifecycle state but not the onStop lifecycle state of the caller Activity, because caller Activity is still visible in the background.

Returning from this Activity will trigger onResume lifecycle state of the caller Activity.
This button will start a new Dialog activity, and will trigger onPause lifecycle state because the caller Activity UI will be visible in the background.
This button will start a new Settings Activity, and will trigger onPause and onStop lifecycle state respectively, because the caller Activity UI won\'t be visible in the background.

This button will destroy the caller Activity, and it will trigger onPause, onStop and onDestroy lifecycle state respectively. Most likely, you will not see the toast for onDestroy state because Activity has been destroyed and toast cannot be displayed.
When this Activity first appears, it will go through the onCreate, onStart, and onResume lifecycle states respectively. A toast message will appear, indicating the current state.
To manually trigger other activity lifecycle states, use the buttons above.
